creditline: Gift of Mrs. George P. Douglas
markings:
Chop: [A Pipie & Sons: Bristol Board];
Along upper 1/2 of the bristol board a lighter weight paper has been attached. This has been drawn over and includes the words [A Californian's.] Upper left corner in pen appears [A3520]. Along the lower edge is numerous pencil notation, from left to right: 9763-1, May J... unreadable word, 2 cols., 5-1/4, Title Lick Observatory, 10. Verso: written in black pencil at center [Cty a910]; Lower rt corner [32-62]; lower left corner: D. Douglas collector's mark; stamped in violet ink at center: [Property of THE CENTURY Co., Union Square NEW YORK, Notice to engravers Five fine proofs are required. No proofs of engravings made for publication of THE CENTURY CO are to borrow by engravers before publication, without the consent of the company. ...publicly exhibited...] the rest is unreadable.
medium: Pen and black ink, with white heightening on Bristol board
title: A Californian's Gift to Science
